intro: Hygrophila gossweileri, commonly known as the African water hyssop, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It thrives in moist to wet environments, often found in marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is adapted to waterlogged soils and has a fibrous root system that helps stabilize the soil. Hygrophila gossweileri is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to filter water and prevent erosion.
